data.title: MultiPersistent Issues
data.body:
So I've been trying to work with the MultiPersistent module across multiple runnings of the game and from other titles. Here is a shortened example:

```
init:

    $ mp = MultiPersistent("test.johnpdoran.com")

    python:
        if mp.beat_part_one  is None:
            mp.beat_part_one  = False;
       mp.save();
```

And this will work fine, even when I load from other titles. However this:

start:
        scene bg classroom
        with dissolve

```
    $ mp.beat_part_one = True;
    $ mp.save();
```

Will show up as True in the game, but if I start the game again it will go back to being False again and in the other game it will go back to none.

The other title looks like this:

```
...

init:
    $ mp = MultiPersistent("test.johnpdoran.com")

# The game starts here.
label start:
    if(mp.beat_part_one):
        "Whoo!"

    e "You've created a new Ren'Py game."

    return
```

I look in the developer console and it shows up as being None at this point. To verify the files were changing I've used WinMerge and verified that data does change when it's set to True, however it isn't being loaded

data.title: Runtime crash
data.body: http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=32&t=27720#p334187

data.title: ren'py seems to lose track of its labels when you combine the console and shift-R
data.body:
I just tested this with the example project The Question and it happens there consistently too. maybe it only happens to me but it does happen consistently across projects.

1) open a project and start the game
2) open the console
3) make a change to one of the source files. any change, even commenting out something unimportant
4) close the console and hit shift-R for a reload
line 549 in renpy\script.py 
   raise ScriptError("could not find label '%s'." % str(label)) 
gets triggered.

I kind of hacked that raise out on my side and return fail-safe labels so I can keep going, but I think this is actually a symptom of a deeper issue, as a lot of our users are complaining about old save files somehow not being able to load with a similar exception

File "renpy/common/00action_file.rpy", line 322, in **call**
renpy.load(fn)
Exception: Couldn't find a place to stop rolling back. Perhaps the script changed in an incompatible way?

we do not actually change label names and some saves work fine and some consistently throw this error. I've yet to find a pattern in this.

data.title: Self-voicing is not documented in README.html
data.body: This is an end-user facing feature, so we should document it there.

data.title: Clipboard voicing.
data.body: Basically, self-voicing, but to the clipboard rather than the speech synthesizer. This is intended to allow screenreaders (and other technology, like braille keyboards) access to the text.

data.title: Character Namespace
data.body:
We should support:

```
define character.e = Character("Eileen")
```

This would define e in the character namespace (store.character). 

Say statements would check the character namespace before the main store when finding the character to use. This would let us reuse character names as objects when necessary.

data.title: lint picks up '%' string format codes despite the feature being disabled
data.body:
Example code:

init:
    $ config.old_substitutions = False

label start:

```
scene black
"LINT PICKS UP STRING FORMAT CODES EVEN WHEN OLD-STYLE SUBSTITUTIONS ARE DISABLED"

"Now with 100% more troublemaking!"

return
```

data.title: lint doesn't parse 'show image' with partial attribute specification
data.body:
Lint doesn't follow image attributes well.  Example code:

```
image e a1 b1 = "#222"
image e a1 b2 = "#444"
image e a2 b1 = "#666"
image e a2 b2 = "#888"

define e = Character('Eileen', color="#c8ffc8", image="e")

label main_menu:        # comment this section out if the bug isn't at the main menu
    return

label start:

    scene black
    "LINT NOT TRACKING MULTIPLE IMAGE PARAMETERS PROPERLY"

    show e a1 b1
    e "showing 222"
    show e b2
    e "showing 444"
    show e a2
    e "showing 888"
    show e b1
    e "showing 666"

    return
```

data.title: Frame(Solid("...")) crashes on Android.
data.body:
From my PMs:

Displayable with following example

```
image so = Frame(Solid("#48a8"),12,12)
```

Works fine on desktop but Freezes Android

how to replicate:
- declare and implement mentioned displayable
- compile game for android
- bug will effect when displayable have to show

example game source if needed
http://www.mediafire.com/download/26h16wah5pv7x73

example compiled game if needed
http://www.mediafire.com/download/242keksthk21vp4

data.title: Game Crashes when CGs achieved out of order.
data.body:
Some CGs have alternate versions based on the character's clothing. The gallery code is as follows:
    g.button("adam04")
    g.unlock_image("cg adam04 top01")
    g.unlock_image("cg adam04 top02")
    g.unlock_image("cg adam04 top03")

If the player unlocks "cg adam04 top02" first, the gallery thumbnail shows up as unlocked, but when the user clicks on it, "cg adam04 top01" is shown, then the game crashes with this traceback:

I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  File "renpy/common/00gallery.rpy", line 452, in show
    index = images.index((button, image))
ValueError: (4, 0) is not in list

data.title: fix doc
data.body:
Fixed typo

```
 # Show an image on a user-defined layer.
-    show moon on user_layer
+    show moon onlayer user_layer
```

data.title: Crashes on Macs with multiple monitors.
data.body: Per http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/ucp.php?i=pm&mode=view&p=137761 , which is one of my PMs on LSF.

data.title: Forcable window size > screen size - 102
data.body:
Hej hej!

Could you maybe add a config option to force a physical window size > screen size - 102?

Yes, I know I could just remove the - 102 myself. But if I wanted to, say, distribute a Ren'Py game, then I'd need to recompile _renpy.so for every platform. And thinking about pulling ffmpeg into my local Mac OS X and Windows cross-compilers fills me with dread; I have passing knowledge of the ffmpeg codebase and I fear that won't be easy. Let alone finding out how to tell cython to use the cross-compilers.

I'd rather there was a more elegant solution to that problem of the window being too big to be resizable. Just clamping the size to screen size - 102 sounds like a rather hacky idea to me, to be frank...

Cheers
Sven

data.title: config.tts_function to support user defined TTS processor
data.body:
This branch adds config.tts_function to support user defined TTS function.
(Related to #400)

The shortest example code:

```
init -1 python hide:
    # This function write TTS texts to stdout
    def print_stdout(s):
        print s

    config.tts_function = print_stdout
```

We can change print_stdout to make variation.
Is it possible to give character names to TTS function? It becomes a hint to change the voice like a boy or a girl.

data.title: Ren'Py may have to export read texts
data.body:
Current development will support self-voicing and it's very amazing feature.
However, the self-voicing feature specifies speech synthesizers directly and it's not flexible.

"espeak" doesn't work good with Japanese so we want to change it to Open JTalk, and blind people may also want to use a braille display.
Please also export raw texts to support other interfaces.

data.title: Launcher Text Size
data.body: Make the text in the launcher adjustable.

data.title: automatically define composite images
data.body:
I allowed Ren'Py to also define composite images automatically.

I added two config variables

.. var:: config.automatic_images_parts = None

```
If this and `config.automatic_images` are not None, this causes Ren'Py
to automatically also define composite images.

When not set to None, this should be set to a list of strings giving
directories that include images which are parts of composite images.

Parts are composited from left to right and all parts must be same size.
```

.. var:: config.automatic_images_not_necessary_parts = []

```
A list of strings giving directories including images which are not
necessary parts for composite images.


For example, if relative variables are set like below:

* config.automatic_images = ["/"]
* config.automatic_images_parts = ["body", "face", "sweat", "surplus"]
* config.automatic_images_not_necessary_parts = ["sweat"]

and your game directly contains, :

* eileen/body/b1.png
* eileen/body/b2.png
* eileen/face/f1.png
* eileen/face/f2.png
* eileen/sweat/sweat.png

then below images are defined :

* eileen b1 f1
* eileen b1 f1 sweat 
* eileen b1 f2
* eileen b1 f2 sweat 
* eileen b2 f1
* eileen b2 f1 sweat 
* eileen b2 f2
* eileen b2 f2 sweat
```
